did.unittitle: Celestine De Martini photographs of the Ryder Club Grand March and the Italian American Civic Union Banquet

physdesc.extent: two items housed in one folder and one oversize box.

did.abstract: The Celestine De Martini photographs of the Ryder Club Grand March and the Italian American Civic Union Banquet is comprised of two black-and-white group portraits. One group portrait shows the annual banquet of the Italian American Civic Union, held on Columbus Day, 1913. The photographer was J. G. Waters. The second group portrait shows a large group of men and women in formal dress at Prospect Hall in Brooklyn performing the Grand March during a ball held by the Ryder Club, 1914. The photographer was by M. Gorodess. De Martini's father is in both photographs, but is not specifically identified.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Celestine De Martini photographs of the Ryder Club Grand March and the Italian American Civic Union Banquet is comprised of two black-and-white group portraits. One group portrait shows the annual banquet of the Italian American Civic Union, held on Columbus Day, 1913. The photographer was J. G. Waters. bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Celestine De Martini was a resident of Carroll Gardens neighborhood of Brooklyn, and worked as a civilian employee of the United States Navy at the Brooklyn Navy Yard (officially known as the New York Naval Shipyard) during the Second World War. Her father, Anthony De Martini, served as a Deputy Sheriff and was involved in numerous civic and political organizations including the Italian American Civic Union. He also served as alternate delegate to the Republican National Convention in the 1920s. In the 1930s, the De Martini family lived at 73 First Place in Carroll Gardens.
